comment.author: 59410977@N08
comment._content: Sir Apolo Kagwa Kaggwa. Kagwa served as regent until 1914 when the infant King Daudi Chwa came of ag. Was one of the negotiators of the Uganda Agreement, by which Buganda became a British protectorate with limited internal autonomy.He was the first African to receive the honour of knighthood. The most skillful politician on the Uganda scene before independence. I dont know the lady in picture, but obvious his wife, as it was unlikely for men those dys to have their women around them apart form their wives.

comment.author: 59404027@N03
comment._content: Sir A.Kagwa, was a prime minister [ Katikiro ] during the first Kabaka Mutesa's rule, with Kisingiri [ treasurer] and Mugwanya i/c of justice. The Ugandan Agreement was drafted and signed by the first Kisingiri, who was fluent in English...check on the web for Appolo Kagwas foundation, have details and contact's of his family...

comment.author: 42288525@N03
comment._content: Sir Apolo Kaggwa, K.C.M.G., M.B.E. (1864–1927), Prime Minister (Katikkiro) of the Kingdom of Buganda,1890-1926.

comment.author: 71034505@N06
comment._content: According to Sir Heskith-Bell in 'Glimpses of a Governors Life' he received his Knighthood in error, he was supposed to get an Hon. C. M. G. but this was mis-read by a clerk at the FO as K. C. M.G. and by the time the error had been spotted it had already been Gazetted.
